title: (x) Old style typeface from a book cover - New Clear Era {Fabio Augusto}
content:
I’m going nuts trying to figure out this typeface from the title of [History Lesson for Girls](http://web.archive.org/web/20070716091317/http:/images.amazon.com/images/P/0670037672.01._SS500_SCLZZZZZZZ_V1137794343_.jpg).

Could it be just customised Plantin Schoolbook, Bembo Schoolbook or even Musee (DStype)?

EDIT: Image deleted due replication. (See below :)

 [‹ (x) "Good things ..." French Script - Adine Kirnberg Script {Stephen L}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070716091317/http:/typophile.com/node/28761 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Big and bold serif on E4 website - custom face by Fontsmith {Erik S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070716091317/http:/typophile.com/node/28815 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tomii

comments.content: Darn, it’s a little bit too small to make it out clearly... :^/

Has someone been tweaking Bembo Schoolbook?

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/bembo-mt/schlbk/charmap.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070716091317/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/bembo-mt/schlbk/charmap.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/bembo-mt/schlbk/charmap.html")
The f, y and G are forced ... Oh! Oops the y is that way in the typeface. :^D My bad.
I think the terminal in ’y’ is too sharp and hook of ’f’ is too short to be Bembo or Plantin..? Also the G could be swash cap

The sample is very small, but look the use of various “mix variants” from the typeface New Clear Era, designed by Bob Aufuldish.

See here:  
 [http://www.fontboy.com/catalog/newclearera/ncsf.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070716091317/http:/www.fontboy.com/catalog/newclearera/ncsf.html "http://www.fontboy.com/catalog/newclearera/ncsf.html")
Seems like we have a winner.. thanks!!
